title: Permaban Lift
body: So I was permabanned for toxicity. HEAR ME OUT though. The game that got me permabanned someone from my own team had went AFK. On top of that 4v5, enemy team was absolutely trolling us basically showing off that they are winning a 4v5. It was incredibly tilting and I couldn't help but be upset. It was the third AFK in ranked that week I believe. My memory is a bit shady on it as it happened a while ago but I do remember being very upset that people can troll us for losing a 4v5. Things got out of hand but the enemy team was ALSO toxic yet i'm permabanned. I was wondering if there is a way to get the ban lifted and have my chat perma disabled as I have zero interest in the toxicity.

If you play plenty of games, your punishment tier will reduce. For an average player, it takes around 3 months to drop a tier.

Technically you can have 2 separate 14-day bans that don't escalate each other.  Game play offense (trolling, inting, griefing, intentional afk, etc.) and verbal offense (chat-base toxicity) are on 2 separate tracks and getting punished for one does not escalate the other.  For example, if you get 14-day from game play, you can still just receive chat restriction on your next punishment for verbal.  Having 14-day for verbal does not mean you will get perma if you get hit by game play next time.

I would say its more feasible to control your actions, than emotions. Thats a very human thing. How do you just control it like that? You make it sound like it was his choice to be upset. I dont think human emotions work that way. You can still control your actions in an upset state of mind, but I dont think one can prevent themselves from feeling upset in the first place. Obviously to an extent you can, but certainly not like a switch you can just turn off or on and just decide not to feel an emotion.

Or...you could not play the semantics game with me.

His emotions aren't the problem. His lack of self-control over his **actions** (flaming his teammates by typing with his fingers) was the problem. My apologies for not being absolutely 100% clear. Either way, Riot punished him for his actions, and that's the bottom line.

I feel like this is a good opportunity for you to reinvent yourself. Start over at level 1. 

Also here is some advice: 

So next time you feel the odds are stacked against your, and YOU don't have the skill necessary to turn it around, just be calm and move on. Being keyboard warrior and raging at your teammates wont win you the game, and started over from honor 0 or level 1 is not fun.

If you were permabanned you had a 14 day ban prior to it warning you that the next punishment would be a permaban. Others breaking the rules doesnt excuse you breaking the rules. You said you were toxic so the ban wasnt in error. That's it, no reason to lift the ban and like the name suggests, it will be permanent.

No, you cannot get the ban lifted simply because you regret your actions **after** the fact - just like how telling the judge "I couldn't help but drink and drive" after the fact isn't going to get you out of jail.
